lines.text: On a September evening in 1938, Father Francis Chisholm returned to his little church near Tweedside, Scotland.
Well, man, don't stand there with half the morning gone - get the rods!
Come along, boy. Wasn't it just fine of God to make all the rivers and fill them all with little fishes and then send you and me here to catch them, Andrew? Hm?

Dear Lord, let me have patience and forbearance where now I have anger. Give me humility, Lord; after all, it was only thy merciful goodness and thy divine providence that saved the boy... but they *are* ungrateful and You know it!

[irritated by Msgr. Mealey's racist remarks]
Father, may I say something sinful?
You will hear it in confession anyway, because I'm thinking it.
...It must be a great blow to you, to see your beautiful church so wantonly destroyed...
...No one can destroy my church... I shall build it again... As long as I live I shall build my church...
